author: Ororu Kaiza

text:
I understood what they were trying to do.  I just didn't like it.  I think Mother 3 handled the story elements much better, because while still having lighthearted comedic moments, many of which parody the genre just as well ad EB, that game still knew when to give us serious moments as well.  Earthbound's lack of a serious plot really gives you little reason to keep playing for in my opinion.

And I wouldn't bring up the music when I'm trying to discuss the game's positives if I were you =P
author: ProjectJ

text: I don't think you really understood the game. It's more of a parody of an RPG than an an actual epic experience. The story doesn't take itself seriously because it's not supposed to, it adds more charm that way. The music actually gives you that eerie feel that the world is in danger, more or less the diolouge/narration.

author: lapras6666

text: @flippyrulz123 This one's subjective, but I didn't like the music. Most people did, but it was honestly ear scraping to me. To be fair, the melodies are good, but the instrument quality was terrible.  It sounded almost like static sometimes, and like farting noises at others.
author: ProjectJ
ProjectJ

text:
@flippyrulz123 Well, bear with me.  I'm gonna rant. For one, the story never took itself seriously. As much as the planet was at stake, it neverï»¿ felt like it was. Lighthearted is one thing, but Earthbound didn't know when to be serious.

I disliked the clunky select system. Press A and you get look, talk, items, etc. Then select again what you want to do. So unnecessary. Why would I look at the person standing in front of me, or talk to a present? It's the only SNES RPG I played that does that.
author: ProjectJ

text: This game is so much better than its predecessor.  As much as I disliked Earthbound, I could replay Mother 3 over and over again.
author: ProjectJ

text: @Salnax Interesting that's good yo know.  I also thought that Mother 1 and 2 were the same game just released on different systems but I see that isn't the case.
author: SpooniestBard

text:
@SpooniestBard Earthbound IS one a Mother game. You know how in America, FF4 was called FF2? Well, the first game in the Mother series, Mother 1, was never released outside of Japan because it came too late in the NES's life. So when Mother 2 was brought to the US, they just called it Earthbound to avoid confusion.

As for Ness, he doesn't really play much of a role in Mother 1 OR 3. The Mother games all take place in the same universe, there are new casts of characters every time.
author: Salnax

text: So are the Mother games continuations of Earthbound then?  With Ness and all them in new situations and adventures?  Man, I wish I spoke Japanese so I could play these.
author: SpooniestBard
